channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: DC is all you need: describing ReLU from a signal processing standpoint
item.description: In this work, we study the spectral behavior of ReLU, a popular activation function.

item.title: Coarse-to-Fine Proposal Refinement Framework for Audio Temporal Forgery Detection and Localization
item.description: Recently, a novel form of audio partial forgery has posed challenges to its forensics, requiring advanced countermeasures to detect subtle forgery manipulations within long-duration audio.

item.title: Open-Set Biometrics: Beyond Good Closed-Set Models
item.description: Biometric recognition has primarily addressed closed-set identification, assuming all probe subjects are in the gallery.

item.title: HyTAS: A Hyperspectral Image Transformer Architecture Search Benchmark and Analysis
item.description: Hyperspectral Imaging (HSI) plays an increasingly critical role in precise vision tasks within remote sensing, capturing a wide spectrum of visual data.

item.title: PrimeGuard: Safe and Helpful LLMs through Tuning-Free Routing
item.description: To address this, we propose PrimeGuard, a novel ITG method that utilizes structured control flow.

item.title: Ranking protein-protein models with large language models and graph neural networks
item.description: A challenging step in this process is the identification of good models (near-native PPI conformations) from the large pool of generated models.

item.title: On ADMM in Heterogeneous Federated Learning: Personalization, Robustness, and Fairness
item.description: Personalized FL (PFL) is an approach that aims to reduce the impact of statistical heterogeneity by developing personalized models for individual users, while also inherently providing benefits in terms of fairness and robustness.

item.title: Finetuning Generative Large Language Models with Discrimination Instructions for Knowledge Graph Completion
item.description: Traditional knowledge graph (KG) completion models learn embeddings to predict missing facts.

item.title: Strike a Balance in Continual Panoptic Segmentation
item.description: First, we introduce past-class backtrace distillation to balance the stability of existing knowledge with the adaptability to new information.

item.title: Dynamic Retraining-Updating Mean Teacher for Source-Free Object Detection
item.description: In object detection, unsupervised domain adaptation (UDA) aims to transfer knowledge from a labeled source domain to an unlabeled target domain.

item.title: A Simulation Benchmark for Autonomous Racing with Large-Scale Human Data
item.description: Despite the availability of international prize-money competitions, scaled vehicles, and simulation environments, research on autonomous racing and the control of sports cars operating close to the limit of handling has been limited by the high costs of vehicle acquisition and management, as well as the limited physics accuracy of open-source simulators.

item.title: On Differentially Private 3D Medical Image Synthesis with Controllable Latent Diffusion Models
item.description: Generally, the small size of public medical imaging datasets coupled with stringent privacy concerns, hampers the advancement of data-hungry deep learning models in medical imaging.

item.title: Spatiotemporal Graph Guided Multi-modal Network for Livestreaming Product Retrieval
item.description: The LPR task encompasses three primary dilemmas in real-world scenarios: 1) the recognition of intended products from distractor products present in the background; 2) the video-image heterogeneity that the appearance of products showcased in live streams often deviates substantially from standardized product images in stores; 3) there are numerous confusing products with subtle visual nuances in the shop.

item.title: MOMAland: A Set of Benchmarks for Multi-Objective Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Many challenging tasks such as managing traffic systems, electricity grids, or supply chains involve complex decision-making processes that must balance multiple conflicting objectives and coordinate the actions of various independent decision-makers (DMs).

item.title: Cross-Domain Separable Translation Network for Multimodal Image Change Detection
item.description: To overcome these limitations, a novel unsupervised cross-domain separable translation network (CSTN) is proposed, which uniquely integrates a within-domain self-reconstruction and a cross-domain image translation and cycle-reconstruction workflow with change detection constraints.

item.title: Advancing Brain Imaging Analysis Step-by-step via Progressive Self-paced Learning
item.description: However, several challenges remain, such as heterogeneity, individual variations, and the contradiction between the high dimensionality and small size of brain imaging datasets.

item.title: Aggregated Attributions for Explanatory Analysis of 3D Segmentation Models
item.description: To this end, we introduce Agg^2Exp, a methodology for aggregating fine-grained voxel attributions of the segmentation model's predictions.

item.title: Diffusion Prior-Based Amortized Variational Inference for Noisy Inverse Problems
item.description: Recent studies on inverse problems have proposed posterior samplers that leverage the pre-trained diffusion models as powerful priors.

item.title: EgoCVR: An Egocentric Benchmark for Fine-Grained Composed Video Retrieval
item.description: In this work, we introduce EgoCVR, a new evaluation benchmark for fine-grained Composed Video Retrieval using large-scale egocentric video datasets.

item.title: Audio Prompt Adapter: Unleashing Music Editing Abilities for Text-to-Music with Lightweight Finetuning
item.description: Text-to-music models allow users to generate nearly realistic musical audio with textual commands.

item.title: INF-LLaVA: Dual-perspective Perception for High-Resolution Multimodal Large Language Model
item.description: However, the quadratic complexity of the vision encoder in MLLMs constrains the resolution of input images.

item.title: SEDS: Semantically Enhanced Dual-Stream Encoder for Sign Language Retrieval
item.description: Furthermore, existing RGB-based sign retrieval works suffer from the huge memory cost of dense visual data embedding in end-to-end training, and adopt offline RGB encoder instead, leading to suboptimal feature representation.

item.title: MonoWAD: Weather-Adaptive Diffusion Model for Robust Monocular 3D Object Detection
item.description: It contains two components: (1) the weather codebook to memorize the knowledge of the clear weather and generate a weather-reference feature for any input, and (2) the weather-adaptive diffusion model to enhance the feature representation of the input feature by incorporating a weather-reference feature.

item.title: Hi-EF: Benchmarking Emotion Forecasting in Human-interaction
item.description: We propose a novel Emotion Forecasting (EF) task grounded in the theory that an individuals emotions are easily influenced by the emotions or other information conveyed during interactions with another person.

item.title: Beyond Binary Gender: Evaluating Gender-Inclusive Machine Translation with Ambiguous Attitude Words
item.description: This study presents a benchmark AmbGIMT (Gender-Inclusive Machine Translation with Ambiguous attitude words), which assesses gender bias beyond binary gender.

item.title: KAN or MLP: A Fairer Comparison
item.description: This paper does not introduce a novel method.

item.title: Learning Trimodal Relation for AVQA with Missing Modality
item.description: Recent Audio-Visual Question Answering (AVQA) methods rely on complete visual and audio input to answer questions accurately.

item.title: BONES: a Benchmark fOr Neural Estimation of Shapley values
item.description: To bridge this gap, we present BONES, a new benchmark focused on neural estimation of Shapley Value.

item.title: SOAP: Enhancing Spatio-Temporal Relation and Motion Information Capturing for Few-Shot Action Recognition
item.description: High frame-rate (HFR) videos of action recognition improve fine-grained expression while reducing the spatio-temporal relation and motion information density.

item.title: Fr√©chet Video Motion Distance: A Metric for Evaluating Motion Consistency in Videos
item.description: Despite the impressive progress, research on metrics for evaluating the quality of generated videos, especially concerning temporal and motion consistency, remains underexplored.

item.title: Diffusion Models for Monocular Depth Estimation: Overcoming Challenging Conditions
item.description: We present a novel approach designed to address the complexities posed by challenging, out-of-distribution data in the single-image depth estimation task.

item.title: QPT V2: Masked Image Modeling Advances Visual Scoring
item.description: To this end, we propose Quality- and aesthetics-aware pretraining (QPT V2), the first pretraining framework based on MIM that offers a unified solution to quality and aesthetics assessment.

item.title: Representation Magnitude has a Liability to Privacy Vulnerability
item.description: The privacy-preserving approaches to machine learning (ML) models have made substantial progress in recent years.

item.title: FoRA: Low-Rank Adaptation Model beyond Multimodal Siamese Network
item.description: In this paper, we propose a novel multimodal object detector, named Low-rank Modal Adaptors (LMA) with a shared backbone.

item.title: SAFNet: Selective Alignment Fusion Network for Efficient HDR Imaging
item.description: Multi-exposure High Dynamic Range (HDR) imaging is a challenging task when facing truncated texture and complex motion.

item.title: Diffusion Models as Optimizers for Efficient Planning in Offline RL
item.description: To evaluate the effectiveness and efficiency of the Trajectory Diffuser, we conduct experiments on the D4RL benchmarks.

item.title: A deeper look at depth pruning of LLMs
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) are not only resource-intensive to train but even more costly to deploy in production.

item.title: Local All-Pair Correspondence for Point Tracking
item.description: We introduce LocoTrack, a highly accurate and efficient model designed for the task of tracking any point (TAP) across video sequences.

item.title: Sparse Prior Is Not All You Need: When Differential Directionality Meets Saliency Coherence for Infrared Small Target Detection
item.description: Infrared small target detection is crucial for the efficacy of infrared search and tracking systems.

item.title: AutoAD-Zero: A Training-Free Framework for Zero-Shot Audio Description
item.description: Our objective is to generate Audio Descriptions (ADs) for both movies and TV series in a training-free manner.

item.title: The Power of Pixels: Exploring the Potential of CNNs for Expected Goals (xG) in Football
item.description: Expected Goals (xG) is a popular metric in football that estimates the likelihood of a shot resulting in a goal.

item.title: Attention Beats Linear for Fast Implicit Neural Representation Generation
item.description: Unlike gradient-based methods, which exhibit lower efficiency in inference, the adoption of hyper-network for generating parameters in Multi-Layer Perceptrons (MLP), responsible for executing INR functions, has surfaced as a promising and efficient alternative.

item.title: Multi-Modality Co-Learning for Efficient Skeleton-based Action Recognition
item.description: Skeleton-based action recognition has garnered significant attention due to the utilization of concise and resilient skeletons.

item.title: Odyssey: Empowering Agents with Open-World Skills
item.description: In this work, we introduce ODYSSEY, a new framework that empowers Large Language Model (LLM)-based agents with open-world skills to explore the vast Minecraft world.

item.title: Efficient Retrieval with Learned Similarities
item.description: We finally compare our techniques with existing approaches, showing that MoL sets new state-of-the-art results on recommendation retrieval tasks, and our approximate top-k retrieval with learned similarities outperforms baselines by up to two orders of magnitude in latency, while achieving > . 99 recall rate of exact algorithms.

item.title: Distance-based mutual congestion feature selection with genetic algorithm for high-dimensional medical datasets
item.description: One recent approach in feature selection is termed frequency-based feature selection.

item.title: CLIP with Generative Latent Replay: a Strong Baseline for Incremental Learning
item.description: Through extensive experiments on different domains, we demonstrate the effectiveness of our framework in adapting to new tasks while improving zero-shot capabilities.

item.title: DriveDiTFit: Fine-tuning Diffusion Transformers for Autonomous Driving
item.description: Such datasets are expected to cover various driving scenarios with adverse weather, lighting conditions and diverse moving objects.

item.title: LongVideoBench: A Benchmark for Long-context Interleaved Video-Language Understanding
item.description: In addition, our results indicate that model performance on the benchmark improves only when they are capable of processing more frames, positioning LongVideoBench as a valuable benchmark for evaluating future-generation long-context LMMs.

item.title: Psychometric Alignment: Capturing Human Knowledge Distributions via Language Models
item.description: We demonstrate that our metric can capture important variations in populations that traditional metrics, like differences in accuracy, fail to capture.
